00:00:04:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:04:020000.Dialogue: Penny, a moment. We just had Thai food. In that culture, the last morsel is called the greng jie piece, and it is reserved for the most important and valued member of the group.

00:00:22:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:22:030000.Dialogue: Thank you all for this high honor.

00:00:26:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:230000.Dialogue: I've seen pictures of your mother; keep eating.

00:00:35:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:35:020000.Dialogue: All right, honey, if we're gonna make the movie, we should go.

00:00:41:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:41:220000.Dialogue: This may be hard for you to hear, but when I say honey, I mean my fiancée.

00:00:49:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:49:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, now it means her.

00:00:53:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:53:200000.Dialogue: It's okay if he wants to come.

00:00:55:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:55:190000.Dialogue: Fine. But next time, we get a sitter.

00:01:00:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:00:000000.Dialogue: All right, I got to go to work. I'll walk down with you.

00:01:01:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:230000.Dialogue: Wait. Which is closer to the new train store in Monrovia, the movie theater or The Cheesecake Factory?

00:01:10:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:10:100000.Dialogue: Oh, well, then I guess it doesn't matter which one of you drives me. Let's play a fun guessing game to see who gets to take me. All right, this four-letter word describes either a printer's type size or a compulsion to eat dirt.

00:01:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:25:130000.Dialogue: Penny, don't give up, you can get this.

00:01:33:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:33:160000.Dialogue: No, I have no interest in model trains, stores that sell them, nor their heartbreaking clientele.

00:01:40:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:40:170000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, I have some work to do, so...

00:01:45:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:45:030000.Dialogue: I can't imagine that would disturb me. Carry on.

00:01:48:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:48:050000.Dialogue: Okay. Wouldn't you be more comfortable at home?

00:01:59:230000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:01:59:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:59:230000.Dialogue: All righty then. Guess I'll just get started.

00:02:04:090000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:02:04:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:04:090000.Dialogue: Leonard, please. I don't need the running commentary.

00:02:55:040000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:02:55:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:58:100000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:02:58:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:59:050000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:02:59:050000.Speaker: Amy

00:03:01:210000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:01:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:04:010000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:04:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:04:010000.Dialogue: I was. Now I'm thinking about what I read.

00:03:20:200000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:20:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:20:200000.Dialogue: You all right, Leonard? You seem very uncomfortable.

00:03:24:130000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:24:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:27:150000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:27:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:27:150000.Dialogue: Should I go? I've been told sometimes I overstay my welcome.

00:03:31:230000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:31:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:35:040000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:35:040000.Speaker: Amy

00:03:44:120000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:44:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:44:120000.Dialogue: Well, you stay as long as you'd like.

00:03:47:070000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:47:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:47:070000.Dialogue: I'm glad to hear you say that, because I'm having a wonderful time.

00:03:52:230000.Scene: The apartment. Amy is staring into space.
00:03:52:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:52:230000.Dialogue: I said the same thing to my gynecologist.

00:04:00:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:00:140000.Dialogue: What are you going to get at the train store, Sheldon?

00:04:03:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:03:120000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm not buying anything. They're having a lecture. H-O gauge railroading.Sheldon Half the size of O-gauge, but twice the fun. Very controversial topic.

00:04:16:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:16:150000.Dialogue: Which side do you come down on?

00:04:18:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:18:120000.Dialogue: I'll let you know after tonight. Unlike some people, I'm going in with an open mind. Who am I kidding? Of course we all know it's O-gauge or no gauge.

00:04:28:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:28:080000.Dialogue: Can you believe grown men sit around and play with toy trains?

00:04:32:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:32:130000.Dialogue: That's pretty big talk for a man with a closet full of magic tricks at his mother's house.

00:04:39:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:39:180000.Dialogue: First of all, they're not tricks, they're illusions.

00:04:42:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:42:020000.Dialogue: And... secondly, when we get married, they're all going up in the attic so you can have that closet for clothes.

00:04:49:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:49:150000.Dialogue: Why would I keep clothes at your mother's house?

00:04:52:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:52:130000.Dialogue: Well, don't think of it that way. Once we move in, it'll be our house.

00:04:57:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:57:200000.Dialogue: Why would she move out? It's her house.

00:05:00:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:00:230000.Dialogue: Hang on. You seriously think I'm going to live with your mother?

00:05:06:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:06:140000.Dialogue: Howard, I think I can help here. Yes, Bernadette, that's exactly what he thinks.

00:05:10:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:10:200000.Dialogue: Why not? It's a great house, plenty of room, and if we have kids, Mom's there to help. You know, en she tells The Three Little Pigs story, she actually has hair on her chinny-chin-chin.

00:05:21:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:21:190000.Dialogue: I'm not gonna live with your mother. Not now, not ever.

00:05:27:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:27:020000.Dialogue: Wow, someone obviously has some mommy issues.

00:05:34:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:34:100000.Dialogue: Don't listen to her. Go to the movie theater.

00:05:40:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:40:050000.Dialogue: Okay, everybody calm down. There is a simple solution here. Raj, take me to the train store, and then I don't care what you people do.

00:05:57:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:57:060000.Dialogue: It was good, good. Just out of curiosity, what time do you usually go to bed?

00:06:03:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:03:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm up all night. I'm like a possum.

00:06:08:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:08:210000.Dialogue: Boy, you were not liked in high school, were you?

00:06:11:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:11:160000.Dialogue: Not really. Is that my yearbook?

00:06:13:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:13:050000.Dialogue: Mm-hmm. Dear Leonard, you're really good at science.   Amy Maybe one day you'll come up with a cure for being a dork.

00:06:20:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:20:220000.Dialogue: Well, it wasn't spray-painting a lightning bolt on my briefcase, I can tell you that.

00:06:26:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:26:140000.Dialogue: If it makes you feel any better, the only person who signed my yearbook was my mother.

00:06:37:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:37:180000.Dialogue: Well, you can add Jerry's Junction to the list of train stores Sheldon Cooper will never set foot in again.

00:06:48:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:030000.Dialogue: You don't know the half of it. It was billed as a lively give-and-take on the merits of model train sizes. But it was actually a setup to intimidate weak-minded spineless rubes into buying H-O starter sets.

00:07:01:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:01:110000.Dialogue: I don't want to talk about it.

00:07:04:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:04:210000.Dialogue: But it's not a spine, I'll tell you that.

00:07:07:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:07:190000.Dialogue: Well, I had a delightful evening, Leonard. We should do this again sometime.

00:07:13:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:13:200000.Dialogue: Glad to hear it. I need someone to accompany me to the wedding of Dr. Moranelli and Dr. Gustufson this Friday. They're kind of the Brad and Angelina of the primatology department.

00:07:23:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:23:230000.Dialogue: I would, but the last wedding we went to was a disaster. He behaved like a child the entire time.

00:07:29:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:210000.Dialogue: Not my fault. You said there'd be other scientists there my age.

00:07:38:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:38:050000.Dialogue: Doesn't matter. You're out, he's in. No date to the prom, two dates to a wedding. Hmm, how times change.

00:07:48:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:48:080000.Dialogue: Ha-ha, you have to go to a wedding.

00:07:56:090000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:07:56:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:07:57:090000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:07:57:090000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:07:57:090000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Could you get it?!

00:07:58:130000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:07:58:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:58:130000.Dialogue: I just said I'm getting it!

00:07:59:230000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:07:59:230000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz

00:08:01:090000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:01:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:08:04:210000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:04:210000.Speaker: Howard

00:08:06:150000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:06:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:06:150000.Dialogue: Hey. I don't want to fight. I was just surprised when you sprung the whole living-with-your-mom stuff on me.

00:08:13:080000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:13:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:13:080000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, I'm sorry I didn't run it by you first.

00:08:17:180000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:17:180000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:08:17:180000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: I don't know who you're talking to, but in or out! We don't need bugs!

00:08:23:230000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:23:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:23:230000.Dialogue: The bugs only come here because you're their queen!

00:08:31:030000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:31:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:31:030000.Dialogue: Listen, how about this. Before we make any kind of decision about where we live, we have a trial run. Stay here for a weekend, see what it's like.

00:08:39:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:39:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:39:170000.Dialogue: And your mom would be okay with that?

00:08:41:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:41:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:41:170000.Dialogue: Sure she would. Ma, do you mind if Bernadette stays here this weekend?!

00:08:45:150000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:45:150000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:08:45:150000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Hey, if she's willing to give the milk away for free, who am I to say no?!

00:08:52:180000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:52:180000.Speaker: Howard

00:08:55:140000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Amy rings the bell.
00:08:55:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:08:55:140000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Frankly, after all your sleepovers with the little brown boy, a girl is a big relief!

00:09:13:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:13:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:13:110000.Dialogue: All these years, I've been so wrong. The tinier the train, the more concentrated the fun.

00:09:24:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:24:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:24:170000.Dialogue: You're a brain scientist. Can you explain to me why a brilliant man likes playing with toy trains?

00:09:29:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:29:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:29:210000.Dialogue: Not without cutting his head open, no.

00:09:34:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:34:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:34:020000.Dialogue: How about making my eyes like Cleopatra?

00:09:36:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:36:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:38:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:38:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:38:110000.Dialogue: Perhaps you're right. My cheekbones and beckoning pelvis already have a certain hello sailor quality to them.

00:09:45:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:45:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:46:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:46:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:49:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:49:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:53:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:53:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:53:080000.Dialogue: He's better than James Bond, because he's tinier.

00:09:58:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:09:58:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:58:030000.Dialogue: I got you this to give to me.

00:10:00:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:00:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:00:170000.Dialogue: Oh, sweetie, guests don't normally wear corsages to a wedding. That's more of a prom thing.

00:10:06:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:06:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:06:230000.Dialogue: I never went to my prom. My mom paid my cousin to take me, but he just used the money to buy drugs.

00:10:13:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:13:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:21:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:21:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:21:070000.Dialogue: When you're done copping a feel, that goes on my wrist.

00:10:27:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:27:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:32:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing with his train set.
00:10:32:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:32:030000.Dialogue: (normal voice): It's official. I'm an H-O trainiac.

00:10:42:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:42:070000.Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, I guess. Does your mother always cut your meat for you?

00:10:53:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:53:150000.Dialogue: Well, don't be jealous, babe. Someday you'll get to cut it for me.

00:10:57:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:10:57:140000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Bernadette! I found the extra head for the Waterpik if you want to use it!

00:11:05:180000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:11:05:180000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: You sure?! I just squirted half a brisket outta my teeth!

00:11:10:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:10:140000.Dialogue: Hey, Ma, how about a little privacy?!

00:11:13:100000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:11:13:100000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Oh, I know what that means!

00:11:23:110000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:11:23:110000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Let me know when you're done canoodling!

00:11:46:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:46:210000.Dialogue: No, thank you. I'm really not much of a dancer.

00:11:51:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:51:080000.Dialogue: You're not exactly winning any trophies as a conversationalist, either.

00:11:57:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:57:130000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. The bride and groom seem happy.

00:12:01:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:01:130000.Dialogue: AMY: Why shouldn't they be? They have a feverish night of socially-approved copulation ahead of them.

00:12:09:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:09:040000.Dialogue: In some cultures, we'd stand outside of their bedroom cheering as they achieved orgasm.

00:12:13:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:100000.Dialogue: That sounds like a late night, and I have work in the morning, so...

00:12:18:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:18:150000.Dialogue: Leonard, you may not have noticed, but I am being a delight here.

00:12:24:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:24:130000.Dialogue: And you're not holding up your end of the evening.

00:12:26:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:26:220000.Dialogue: Oh, sorry. This wedding just reminds me of my kinda-sorta girlfriend 9,000 miles away.

00:12:33:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:33:030000.Dialogue: I have a kinda-sorta boyfriend who's playing with a model train right now, you don't hear me bitching about it.

00:12:42:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:42:040000.Dialogue: Leonard, a word of advice-- moody self-obsession is only attractive in men who can play guitar and are considerably taller than you.

00:12:51:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:51:230000.Dialogue: You have any evidence to support that statement?

00:12:54:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:54:210000.Dialogue: Well, hey, I'm just as much fun as you are.

00:12:57:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:57:170000.Dialogue: Really? Are you willing to draw a mustache on your finger as a conversational icebreaker? I am.

00:13:08:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:08:010000.Dialogue: Okay, fine, what do you suggest?

00:13:12:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:12:110000.Dialogue: We just had a lovely meal, the band... is on fire...

00:13:18:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:18:010000.Dialogue: and you're sitting next to a beautiful woman wearing whorish makeup.

00:13:23:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:23:030000.Dialogue: Why don't we head out on the dance floor and see if I can sweat through these dress shields.

00:13:27:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:27:130000.Dialogue: Once again, I-I'm really not much of a dancer.

00:14:05:230000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:05:230000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:14:09:210000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:09:210000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:11:130000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:11:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:11:130000.Dialogue: No. I need to brush my teeth, but your moth's been in the bathroom for, like, an hour.

00:14:16:040000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:16:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:16:040000.Dialogue: Oh. Yeah, she sometimes has problems doing her business. Hang on. Ma, give up! Tonight's not your night!

00:14:25:030000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:25:030000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:25:030000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: You don't know that! I just sat down!

00:14:28:070000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:28:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:28:070000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Come on, take a break! Bernadette needs to brush her teeth!

00:14:32:070000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:32:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:32:070000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: She can come in and brush her teeth!

00:14:34:070000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:34:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz

00:14:37:060000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:37:060000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:41:010000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:41:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:41:010000.Dialogue: No, it's not. I'm not going in there.

00:14:43:170000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:43:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:43:170000.Dialogue: Oh, come on, honey. She's just sitting in there reading a magazine. You can't see anything. I go in all the time.

00:14:51:150000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:51:150000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:51:150000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Ha! The eagle has landed!

00:14:58:000000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:14:58:000000.Speaker: Howard

00:15:02:130000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is playing with a lightsabre.
00:15:02:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:02:130000.Dialogue: Wait here, I'm gonna go light a candle. And then we make passionate love.

00:15:15:100000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:15:100000.Speaker: Amy

00:15:17:000000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:17:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:17:000000.Dialogue: I just can't figure out what happened. I put my left leg in, I took my left leg out, I put my left leg in, and something just snapped.

00:15:26:030000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:26:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:26:030000.Dialogue: The hokey pokey is a young man's game.

00:15:28:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:28:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:28:230000.Dialogue: (chuckles) I did have a great time. Thank you for reminding me it's okay to have fun once in a while.

00:15:35:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:35:070000.Speaker: Amy

00:15:36:180000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:36:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:36:180000.Dialogue: And also for breaking the head off the ice swan so I could hold it against my pulled groin.

00:15:40:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:40:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:40:190000.Dialogue: I excel at spatial reasoning, and I had a hunch that the graceful slope of its neck would cradle your genitals nicely.

00:15:49:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:49:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:52:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:52:140000.Speaker: Amy

00:15:56:010000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:56:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:58:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:15:58:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:58:120000.Dialogue: No, thanks. I'm gonna head home.

00:16:00:040000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:00:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:02:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:02:080000.Speaker: Amy

00:16:10:210000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:10:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:10:210000.Dialogue: Ames, hi. How was the wedding?

00:16:13:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:13:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:13:070000.Dialogue: Great. Until I accidentally made Leonard fall in love with me.

00:16:20:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:20:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:23:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:23:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:23:120000.Dialogue: Do you want a glass of wine?

00:16:25:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:25:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:25:230000.Dialogue: Wine is one of the reasons I'm in this fix. That and this dang pelvis.

00:16:32:010000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:32:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:32:010000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm sorry, what exactly happened?

00:16:34:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:34:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:34:160000.Dialogue: The inevitable-- he was lonely and vulnerable from missing his girlfriend, while I was charming, supportive and, let's face it, in this dress, the perfect combination of Madonna and whore.

00:16:45:090000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:45:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:45:090000.Dialogue: Oh, God, did he make a move on you?

00:16:48:030000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:48:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:48:030000.Dialogue: No, but it's only a matter of time. How could I have not seen this coming? Now I'm gonna have to break the little sad sack's heart.

00:16:56:170000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:16:56:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:56:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm sure he'll be okay.

00:17:09:170000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:17:09:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:09:170000.Dialogue: So, um, what are you gonna do? Do you want me to talk to Leonard, let him down easy?

00:17:14:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:17:14:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:14:070000.Dialogue: No. I'll let him have tonight. Then in the morning, I'll send him an e-mail letting him know this body is never gonna be his wonderland.

00:17:23:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Amy is helping Leonard up the stairs.
00:17:23:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:23:150000.Dialogue: I mean, frankly, you've got a better shot than he does.

00:17:36:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:36:150000.Dialogue: Leonard. Check it out. I bought an N-gauge locomotive. Half the size of H-O. Look, it fits in my mouth.

00:17:47:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:47:050000.Dialogue: Sounds like you had a great night.

00:17:56:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:56:070000.Dialogue: What exact do you mean by that?

00:17:58:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:58:160000.Dialogue: Well, it turns out she really knows how to help a guy loosen up and have a good time. Although, truth be told, my groin's a little worse for wear.

00:18:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:13:180000.Dialogue: To send a message: she is not for you.

00:18:45:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:45:170000.Dialogue: Yes, it is, and you're so pretty in the morning.

00:18:51:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:51:010000.Dialogue: Your mom and I made you breakfast.

00:18:53:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:53:020000.Dialogue: Oh, wow. So you guys are getting along?

00:18:56:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:56:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, I guess. We're very different people, Howard, so communication's a little tricky.

00:19:02:230000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:02:230000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Does he like the pancakes?!

00:19:13:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:13:070000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: So, what's the word?!

00:19:30:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:30:190000.Dialogue: If you want butter, I'll get you butter.

00:19:37:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:37:170000.Dialogue: Well, I guess I'll cut these by myself.
